Note: ILK is a protein, but since it was mentioned as "ILK mice," it was assumed to be a strain of mice carrying a mutation in the ILK gene. If ILK was mentioned as a chemical compound, it should be presented as "ILK chemical" or "Imperilin chemical" in the table.

Note: In the original paragraph, "Hepatocytes of the ILK / liver - / - mice" refers to a specific type of liver cell (hepatocytes) in mice that carry a mutation in the ILK gene. Since ILK is a protein, it is the only valid chemical entity in the paragraph.
